name.en: Seminar in Philosophy for Children I

goal.ch: 目地在訓練有能力將批判性思考融入兒童哲學之人才，並以遊戲化為主軸，激盪出兒童哲學的引導操作設計。
goal.en: this course aims to train individuals capable of integrating critical thinking into the philosophy for children. It focuses on gamification to inspire the design of guidance and activities in children‘s philosophy.

outline.ch:
扣緊遊戲化四個宗旨：目標，規則，挑戰以及互動做發展。下學期「兒童哲學II」更進一步對比臺灣、美國、法國、日本兒童哲學操作上的差異，並將關注聚焦在倫理、情感衝突議題的思辨設計，輔以設計思考的工具。在設計思考上，延續使用上學期的人物誌、同理心地圖、九宮格、KJ法、A、E、I、O、U觀察架構、魚骨法，5W1H等工具，但更聚焦於衝突問題的收斂解析。最終輔以VR製作，於期末開發出提供給兒童，沉靜式倫理品格學習的VR作品。
第一週(2/20)課程介紹兒童哲學範圍
第二週(2/27)臺灣兒童哲學現在與未來
第三週(3/6)美國兒童哲學發展與操作
第四週(3/13)法國兒童哲學理論與操作
第五週(3/20)日本兒童哲學發展與操作
第六週(3/27)四國兒童哲學論述架構解析
第七週(4/3)放假
第八週(4/10)演講VR操作 (阿特發有限公司)
第九週(4/17)批判性思考在兒童哲學的理論
第十週(4/24)設計思考解析兒童情感、衝突
第十一週(5/1)設計思考解析兒童倫理道德
第十二週(5/8)VR腳本繳交 (期中)
第十三週(5/15)批判性思考在兒童哲學的操作
第十四週(5/22)VR創作
第十五週(5/29)總結兒童哲學的設計掌握
第十六週(6/6)成果分享
outline.en:
Developed around the four pillars of gamification: goals, rules, challenges, and interaction, the course progresses in the next semester with “Philosophy for Children II.“ It further compares the differences in children‘s philosophy practices in Taiwan, the United States, France, and Japan, focusing particularly on the design of reflective thinking in ethics and emotional conflict issues, supplemented by design thinking tools. Continuing from the previous semester‘s use of tools such as personas, empathy maps, 9-box grids, the KJ method, the AEIOU framework, fishbone diagrams, and the 5W1H method, the course will now focus more on the convergent analysis of conflict issues. Ultimately, students will create VR productions, developing immersive ethical learning experiences for children to be presented at the end of the semester.
Week 1: Course Introduction and Scope of Philosophy for Children
Week 2: The Present and Future of Philosophy for Children in Taiwan
Week 3: Development and Practice of Philosophy for Children in the United States
Week 4: Theory and Practice of Philosophy for Children in France
Week 5: Development and Practice of Philosophy for Children in Japan
Week 6: Analysis of the Discourse Frameworks in Four Countries
Week 7: take a holiday
Week 8: Lecture on VR Operation (Artware Corporation)
Week 9: Theories of Critical Thinking in Philosophy for Children
Week 10: Design Thinking for Analyzing Children‘s Emotions and Conflicts
Week 11: Design Thinking for Analyzing Children‘s Ethics and Morality
Week 12: Submission of VR Script (Midterm)
Week 13: Practice of Critical Thinking in Philosophy for Children
Week 14: VR Production
Week 15: Mastery of Design in Philosophy for Children
Week 16: Presentation of Results
